meanings.definition: In a heavy or sluggish manner.
meanings.sent1: She walked leadenly to the bus stop, dragging her feet along the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The old dog moved leadenly, struggling to keep up with the energetic puppies.
meanings.sent3: The sloth moved leadenly through the trees, taking its time to reach the next branch.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass leadenly as they waited for the test results to come back.
meanings.sent5: The heavy rain fell leadenly from the dark clouds above, soaking everything in its path.

meanings.definition: With a dull or lifeless quality.
meanings.sent1: Her leadenly expression showed no excitement or interest in the conversation.
meanings.sent2: The leadenly sky signaled the approaching storm with its dark and ominous clouds.
meanings.sent3: The leadenly music playing in the background made the party feel more like a funeral.
meanings.sent4: His leadenly eyes revealed the deep sadness he was trying to hide from others.
meanings.sent5: The leadenly atmosphere in the room made it hard to stay awake during the boring presentation.
